content: Sure. We’re getting a bit pedantic here, but when a CFO chooses a new way to price a product, she has an intent (i.e. to sell more products at a better margin.) She’s hoping a customer sees the product offering and chooses to spend money. That’s intent. It may not consider the user experience in a very sophisticated way and the downstream effects will possibly not match her intent. Oliver Baier made a similar point as well in this comment thread.
